item.title: Classes of simple derivations on polynomial rings $k[x_1,x_2, \ldots ,x_n]$
item.description: arXiv:2501.14415v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $k$ be a field of characteristic zero. Let $m$ and $\alpha$ be positive integers. For $n\geq 2$, let $R_n=k[x_1,x_2,\dots,x_n]$ with the $k$-derivation $d_n$ given by $d_n=(1-x_1x_2^{\alpha})\partial_{x_1}+x_1^m\partial_{x_2}+x_2\partial_{x_3}+\dots+x_{n-1}\partial_{x_n}$. We prove that for all odd $\alpha \geq 1$ and all odd $m\geq 3$, $d_n$ is a simple derivation on $R_n$ and $d_n(R_n)$ contains no units. This generalizes a result of D. A. Jordan. We also show that the isotropy group of $d_n$ is conjugate to a subgroup of translations.
item.dc:creator: Sumit Chandra Mishra, Dibyendu Mondal, Pankaj Shukla

item.title: Additive subgroups of a module that are saturated with respect to a fixed subset of the ring
item.description: arXiv:2501.11575v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Let $T$ be a subset of a ring $A$, and let $M$ be an $A$-module. We study the additive subgroups $F$ of $M$ such that, for all $x \in M$, if $tx \in F$ for some $t \in T$, then $x \in F$. We call any such subset $F$ of $M$ a $T$-factroid of $M$, which is a kind of dual to the notion of a $T$-submodule of $M$. We connect the notion with the zero-divisors on $M$, various classes of primary and prime ideals of $A$, Euclidean domains, and the recent concepts of unit-additive commutative rings and of Egyptian fractions with respect to a multiplicative subset of a commutative ring. We also introduce a common generalization of local rings and unit-additive rings, called *sublocalizing* rings, and relate them to $T$-factroids.
item.dc:creator: Jesse Elliott, Neil Epstein
